HDG.LOG.content: a swarming multiplicity of meanings nestles (verschwimmende Mannigfaltigkeit von Bedeutungen nistet) in both these dangerously harmless words: en and panta [plurivocity over dissemination]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: a swarming multiplicity of meanings nestles (verschwimmende Mannigfaltigkeit von Bedeutungen nistet) in both these dangerously harmless words: en and panta [plurivocity over dissemination]

HDG.LOG.content: [method of plurivocity? compare to Derrida, dissemination] succeed in delineating more meaningfully a few characteristics of en and panta: delineation should remain a preliminary free-flowing sketch, not self-assured portrayal > must reflect w/in unity of Heraclitus’ saying [closed-context?]

HDG.LOG.linkedContent: [method of plurivocity? compare to Derrida, dissemination] succeed in delineating more meaningfully a few characteristics of en and panta: delineation should remain a preliminary free-flowing sketch, not self-assured portrayal > must reflect w/in unity of Heraclitus’ saying [closed-context?]

HDG.ID.content: the frame (Ge-stell) as a 2nd forgetting [?], prevents even Being of beings as presence > w/in Ge-stell must experience (erfahren) strange ownership/appropriation in which man & Being are delivered over to each other, must enter into Ereignis (event of appropriation), the word Ereignis [“the words” in English translation] should speak as a key term in service of thinking [via dissemination, Derrida deconstructs “key”] > Ereignis as singulare tantum, happens only in singular, not in any number, uniquely (einzig)

HDG.IM.content: [for Derrida, etymology serves dissemination] must grasp fully last remnant [verbliebenen Rest] of a connection [Bezugs] to Being (now that word is empty) [trace]

HDG.IM.linkedContent: [for Derrida, etymology serves dissemination] must grasp fully last remnant [verbliebenen Rest] of a connection [Bezugs] to Being (now that word is empty) [trace]

HDG.IM.content: from 3 etymological stems of Being: living, emerging, abiding [compare how Heidegger uses etymology to Derrida, dissemination] > different meanings imply experiences > Nothing arises merely through loss [re: not tracing how the different meanings grow together into one verb] [annihilation of trace?]

HDG.IM.linkedContent: from 3 etymological stems of Being: living, emerging, abiding [compare how Heidegger uses etymology to Derrida, dissemination] > different meanings imply experiences > Nothing arises merely through loss [re: not tracing how the different meanings grow together into one verb] [annihilation of trace?]

HDG.BC.content: beings always have their equal [Being] > Being is incomparable, unique, always the Same, a sameness that doesn’t exclude differences [indifference point] > no various Being, can’t break up into multiple/numerous [dissemination vs. plurivocity]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: beings always have their equal [Being] > Being is incomparable, unique, always the Same, a sameness that doesn’t exclude differences [indifference point] > no various Being, can’t break up into multiple/numerous [dissemination vs. plurivocity]
